products.title: Cherry Tomato
products.body_html: Cherry tomatoes , also known as Plum tomatoes or paste tomatoes are believed to be an intermediate genetic admixture. The flavor will be a fine balance of sweet and tart. Toss it up with your favourite pastas or use it as a pizza topping.Store in a cool, dry place, away from direct sunlight.

products.title: Button Mushroom
products.body_html: Button mushrooms are the younger version of the classic white/brown mushroom. It has a mild, earthy flavor flavour with a tender texture. Add them to a risotto or saute them with other vegetables for a perfect dinner. Leave it in the packaging and wash right before consuming. For freshness, consume within 24-36 hours.

products.title: Ivy Gourd
products.body_html:
Ivy Gourd or Tindora are small fruit with smooth skin with light green stripes and underneath that lies translucent white flesh which is aqueous and crisp. The fruit are juicy and crunchy with a slightly bitter aftertaste. As it matures the fruit becomes bright red and becomes sweet. Tindora is eaten raw as a salad and it is more popularly cooked and added to curries, stir fries and used as a main ingredient in Indian pickles and Chutneys. Store in a paper bag in refrigerator.

products.title: Colors of Capsicum
products.body_html: The capsicum comes in several colours , more popularly in green, red and yellow. They have a smooth glossy skin and a sharp crispy juicy flesh which has a slightly pungent taste. Chop and stir fry with onions and cottage cheese or chicken with a drizzle of soy sauce and red chilli sauce for a taste preparation. Store in refrigerator.

products.title: Green Peas
products.body_html: Green peas are the young edible leaves and steps of a pea plant. Green peas have a subtle earthy aroma and are crisp with a sweet, nutty, fresh and grassy flavour. Grees peas are traditionally consumed in Asian cuisine and are used in a variety of recipes. Cook the peas with cottage cheese in a tomato onion gravy to get the staple dish of most Indian households ��� ���Matar Paneer���. Store in airtight b

products.title: Broccoli - Florets
products.body_html: A quick and efficient way to ensure you don't trim off more than is required when processing a head of brocolli. The ready cut florets make blanching and sauteeing the brocolli so much easier and more convenient.

products.title: Baby Corn
products.body_html: Baby corn has a mild sweet corn flavour and an earthy, vegetal taste. It is used popularly in soups, stirfries, grills, or as a batterfried snack. Keep in GG packaging and refrigerate until use.

products.title: Red Capsicum
products.body_html: Red capsicum are thin smooth skinned capsicums with a glossy red skin. They are mildly sweet in taste with a crunchy texture. Slice and use in salads and pastas for an extra pinch in flavour or chop and use in a chicken or coleslaw sandwich. Store in refrigerator

products.title: Purple Cabbage
products.body_html: Purple cabbage is characterized by its distinct colour, texture and flavour. The leaves are violet or burgundy in colour and their flavour is bold, cruciferous and peppery. It lacks water which makes it chewier and coarser than green cabbage. It Is a staple in European cuisine, used in both raw and cooked applications. Complement it with grilled meats, olive oil, butter and cheese! Keep in plastic bag and store in refrigerator.

products.title: Malabar Cucumber
products.body_html: The Malabar cucumber has light green smooth skin with dark green stripes and is also known as Mangalore cucumbers, Madras cucumbers, etc. Belonging to the same family as pumpkins and melons, these cucumbers are crunchy and watery with a mild floral flavour. They are best suited for boiling, stir frying or pickling. They are commonly cooked in sambar and added to curries. Store in refrigerator.

products.title: Banana Flower
products.body_html: The banana flower is an alkaline superfood with several health benefits. It tastes mildly similar to a banana and the flavour is very subtle, much like the zucchini flower. It is popular in several dishes from southern India and can be used to make curries and stirfries. Keep it in GG packaging, refrigerate immediately until use.

products.title: Yellow Capsicum
products.body_html: Capsicum is a kind of pepper that comes in three colours – red, green and yellow. They are all essentially just green capsicums that have been allowed to ripen for different time lengths. The Greens are harvested the earliest, the red for the longest and the yellow in the middle. The yellow capsicum has a fruity taste that is milder than the others and is hence used in grilled and roasted pan Asian & continental dishes to give a mild and fruity aftertaste. Store unwashed in refrigerator.

products.title: Galangal (Thai Ginger)
products.body_html: The galangal root is a spice native to South Asia. It belongs to the same family as ginger and is widely used in Asian cooking and in Ayurvedic medicine. Galangal has a strong aroma and flavour, similar to that of ginger but with a slight twist. It is simmered in curries to add aroma and flavour and is supposed to have many benefits for inflammation, fertility and even treat infections. Loosely wrap in cling foil and store in refrigerator.

products.title: Tomato
products.body_html:
Tomatoes are round juicy fruit used and cooked as vegetables. They have a bright red glossy skin which encloses a juicy sweet flesh. Tomatoes are eaten raw or used in cooked applications worldwide. Be it Indian, continental or Italian cuisine, tomatoes are an integral ingredient. Slice and serve in a salad or put on a toast with parmesan! Store in refrigerator.

products.body_html: English cucumbers were bred to make a better version of the existing normal cucumber. They are known as burpless, seedless or European cucumbers. products.body_html:

Potatoes are comfort food used in favourite recipes such as French Fries, Mashed potatoes, hash brown, Massaman Curry, Jacket Potatoes or the Indian Tandoori Aaloo. Store in a cool dry place.

products.body_html:

It is also boiled and drank with tea for its medicinal purposes. Store in a cool, dry place away from sunlight.

products.title: Apple - Royal Gala
products.body_html: The Royal Gala apple, which is being grown across in Italy/Poland/New Zealand/Chile a low calorie snack, has a mildly sweet taste with a floral aroma. It makes for a nice snack as well as a great addition to use in salads and desserts. Store at room temperature.

products.title: Mango - Banganapalli
products.body_html: The Banganapalli hails from Andhra Pradesh. Known for its unique, rich and sweet taste, it is significantly larger than its other relatives. The pleasant aroma, smooth skin and fibre free yellow pulp makes the Banganapalli one of the most delicious mangoes. Enjoy them as is or puree to make juices, smoothies and desserts. All mangoes are best stored in their packaging until ripe. Once ripe, remove them from the packaging and store in a cool, dry place. Refrigerate if required before consuming.

products.title: Dragon Fruit
products.body_html: Dragon fruit also known as Patayaha or strawberry pear is a vibrant tropica fruit known for its bright pink skin and its white seed speckled flesh. As exotic as it looks, the dragon fruit has a subtle flavour similar to that of a kiwi or pear. It is sweet, delicate and crunchy. The best way to consume the fruit is to cut it vertically and scoop out the flesh. It can be used in Fruit bowls or in cocktails. Store in refrigerator.

products.title: Pineapple
products.body_html: The pineapple is a tropical fruit rich in vitamins and antioxidants and low in calories. The fruit has a hard scaly exterior and a juicy yellow fleshy interior. The flesh is sweet, sour and citrusy in flavour. The yellow scales can be eaten or pressed into juices, used in salads or desserts such as pineapple cake, trifle pudding, fruit cream and fruit custard. Slice the top of the fruit off then vertically cut off the scaly outer peel. Then make diagonal cuts to carve the fruit out. Store uncut pineapple at room temperature away from sunlight.

products.title: Mango - Alphonso
products.body_html: Known as the King of Mangoes, Alphonso is perhaps one of the most delicious and sought after fruit in the world. The tasty orange flesh of the Alphonso is tangy, juicy and sweet. Enjoy the alphonso as is, press it into a juice, blend it in a milkshake or in desserts such as fruit creams and mango cheesecakes. All mangoes are best stored in their packaging until ripe. Once ripe, remove them from the packaging and store in a cool, dry place. Refrigerate if required before consuming.

products.title: Orange - Valencia
products.body_html: The Valencia orange is a sweet orange and is for this reason primarily grown for processing and orange juice production. Named after Valencia Spain, the fruit is a sweet summer orange. Enjoy the fruit as is or press into a tangy orange juice! Store in refrigerator.

products.title: Fresh Figs
products.body_html: Figs were first grown in the region between Turkey and northern India. Their aromatic red flesh is jellylike and pulpy but not juicy. They taste sweet and moist. Figs are great to eat raw as well as for making jams and tarts. Store in refrigerator.

products.title: Raw Mango
products.body_html: Raw mangoes are hard and green in colour with a white hard flesh. Sour and crispy in flavour raw mangoes are used to make a summer drink called ���Aam panna.��� They are also used to make a mango chutney which is eaten with Indian bread or used in vegetables. Store in a cool dr

products.title: Kiwi - Green
products.body_html: Most people would confuse the Kiwi to come from New Zealand but the fruit is actually native to China. This powerhouse of vitamin C has a fuzzy, brown skin with a light green inside that tastes sweet, tangy and juicy. They make for a nice snack as well as a great addition to salads. Store in refrigerator.

products.title: Red Globe Grapes
products.body_html: The red globe is a variety of very large seeded grapes with firm juicy flesh. These grapes are bigger, juicier and tastier than regular grapes. Grapes are great to munch on as is. Serve them on a platter with strawberries and blueberries and cheese along with a bottle of wine at an intimate dinner. Store in refrigerator.

products.title: Indian Litchi
products.body_html: The Indian Litchy are small round fruit with a pinkish red spiky peel and a juicy white flesh with one big seed within. The flesh is gelatinous, chewy, sweet and fruity with a floral flavour. Lychees are great to munch on as is or convert into juice to make a mouthwatering litchi martini at your next cocktail dinner! Store in refrigerator.

products.title: Mangosteen
products.body_html: The Mangosteen is an exotic tropical fruit native to Thailand. Its delicious sweet and sour flavour is one that hits the spot. Opening the mangosteen is something easy once you understand the technique. One hand has to be placed on top of the fruit and one at the bottom, and enough pressure needs to be applied for the fruit to press open. Once open the beautiful flesh can be scooped out with a spoon and eaten. Store for a short time at room temperature only.

products.title: Mango - Imam Pasand
products.body_html:
The Imam Pasand is a lesser known and exclusive mango variety grown in Andhra Pradesh. It is said to have been the fruit of choice for India’s royalty. With hints of coconut and lime, the Imam Pasand is very different from the usual varieties of sweet mangoes. They are used in curries and cooked dishes. All mangoes are best stored in their packaging until ripe. Once ripe, remove them from the packaging and store in a cool, dry place. Refrigerate if required before consuming.

products.title: Mango - Sindhuri
products.body_html: Distinct in its appearance with pleasant reds and greens, the Sindhuri is very popular in Tamil Nadu and one of the most affordable mangoes. It is also called Honey Mango due to its excessively sweet flavour and strong aroma. It is popularly used in making jams, jellies & preservatives due to its sweetness. All mangoes are best stored in their packaging until ripe. Once ripe, remove them from the packaging and store in a cool, dry place. Refrigerate if required before consuming.

products.title: Mango - Malgova
products.body_html: The Malgova is a round, yellowish-green mango with a light yellow pulp. Mammoth in size, the mango has a sweet and tart flavour. They are the juiciest and most fragrant mangoes, and are popularly eaten all over the world. All mangoes are best stored in their packaging until ripe. Once ripe, remove them from the packaging and store in a cool, dry place. Refrigerate if required before consuming.

products.title: Banana - Yelakki
products.body_html: The Yelakki or Elaichi banana means small size. They are mini versions of regular bananas but are sweeter and tastier. Enjoy munching them as is or chop into a fruit cream, fruit salad, or blend into a smoothie. Store at room temperature.

products.title: Papaya
products.body_html: The papaya is an exotic orange coloured fruit grown in tropical climates. The sweet floral fragrance and flavour and vibrant colour make the papaya a popular fruit. Eat raw or grate and make a Thai raw papaya salad with a dash of lime juice and vinegar. Store in refrigerator.

products.title: Pomegranate
products.body_html: The pomegranate is a medium sized red fruit with a hard leathery peel, enclosing many tiny bursts of red juice. It is termed a superfood due to its massive health benefits. These rubies are bursts of luscious juice and can be eaten as is, pressed into a juice and used in salads and desserts. Cut half an inch of the top of the fruit off, then make shallow vertical cuts with the knife. Then use your finger to pull out the edible fruit. Store the uncut fruit in a cool dry place.

products.title: Banana - Pachbale
products.body_html: Bananas Pachbale are regular to long sized light greenish yellow bananas with a sweet buttery and creamy flesh. Bananas have a sweet, fruity flavour. Enjoy munching them as is or bake into cakes or blend into a smoothie. Store at room temperature.

products.title: Musk Melon
products.body_html: Musk melon is a tropical summer fruit with a musky aroma. The melon is beautiful in appearance and has a jelly like soft orange flesh. The fruit has a high water content and has a refreshing sweet floral flavour. It is also known as sweet melon due to its sugary taste. Eat raw or use to make juices, sorbets and ice creams. Chop in the summer and eat in a big fruit bowl for hydration. Store at room temperature or in refrigerator in hot climatin conditions.

products.title: Sweet Lime
products.body_html: The organic sweet lime, also known as mousami is a citrus fruit, and belongs to the family of sweet lemons. As the name suggests, they are sweet, juicy and citrusy in flavour. It is consumed primarily in the form of juice and can also be used in cocktails & sorbets. Depending on the climatic temperature, store at room temperature or be refrigerate.

products.title: Kashmiri Fresh Cherries
products.body_html: These blood red bites of juicy punch are rich in antioxidants, snackable and nutritious. Sweet and delicious, cherries are often used in baking and cooking apart from being a great snack as is! Slice and use in blackforest cake or use whole to decorate the cake. Store in refrigerator.

products.title: Curry Leaves
products.body_html: These leaves which are extremely aromatic and a bright glossy green, come from curry tree. Organic curry leaves, when fresh, have a heavenly, citrus aroma. Curry leaves are extensively used in Southern Indian and Sri Lankan cuisine, much as coriander leaves are used in the North. Refrigerate until use - store in GG packaging as received, or transfer into a dry box lined with cloth or tissue.
